learning_outcomes.description: Be conversant with of some the major aspects and themes of the Latin American intellectual critical tradition and critics/thinkers studied.
Be able to carry out a close critical and analytic reading
Think critically about texts and apply your knowledge to other issues and texts.
Think through and problematise the normative and received modes of apprehending Latin America and the world around us
Write a critical, argumentative essays which engage with the issues/ideas and texts studied.
Present an essay plans which critically engage with the issues/ideas and texts studied

assessments.task_description:
There will be 6 Online Quizzes available from 7am till 5pm on designated days.

Students will have 8 minutes to finish them once they start.

The Online Quizzes will be multiple choice.

All readings for the ONLINE QUIZZES are available in Blackboard - "Learning Resources".

The schedule of ONLINE QUIZZES is as follows:

  • ONLINE QUIZ 1 - Week 2: Mignolo, Walter. Preface: Uncoupling the name and the reference, The Idea of Latin America. Malden, MA ; Oxford : Blackwell Pub. 2005. (pp.: x-xx)
  • ONLINE QUIZ 2 - Week 4: Sarmiento, Domingo F. Facundo, or Civilization and Barbarism (1845). Nineteenth-century nation building and the Latin American intellectual tradition : a reader / edited and translated by Janet Burke and Ted Humphrey. Indianapolis, IN : Hackett Pub. Co., c2007. (pp. 124-147)
  • ONLINE QUIZ 3 - Week 6: Martí, José. "Our America", Nineteenth-century nation building and the Latin American intellectual tradition : a reader / edited and translated by Janet Burke and Ted Humphrey. Indianapolis, IN : Hackett Pub. Co., c2007. (pp. 260-267)
  • ONLINE QUIZ 4 - Week 9: Boff, Leonardo. Part 1. 1. Ecology. Politics, Theology and Mysticism. Ecology & Liberation. A New Paradigm. Orbis Books: New York: 1995 (pp. 9 - 45)
  • ONLINE QUIZ 5 - Week 10: Krenak, Ailton. Ideas to Postpone the End of the World. Canada: House of Anansi Press, 2020.
  • ONLINE QUIZ 6 - Week 11: Rita Laura Segato, "A Manifesto in Four Themes", Critical Times: Interventions in Global Critical Theory, Vol. 1, No. 1 (2018), pp. 198-211.
